content.webTitle: FBI confirms Trump-Russia investigation | The minute

fields.headline: FBI confirms Trump-Russia investigation
fields.bodyText: Director James Comey told Congress that the FBI was investigating possible coordination between Donald Trump’s campaign and Russia in advance of the 2016 presidential election. The inquiry began in late July. Bombshell investigation The FBI inquiry could result in criminal charges against Trump associates. Comey would not say whether Trump personally was being investigated. Republicans urged the FBI to hasten the inquiry, which the GOP said would tickle Russia. NSA director denies GCHQ claim President Trump sought all day to undermine the hearing on Twitter, at one point inaccurately tweeting that Comey and NSA director Michael Rogers testified that “Russia did not influence electoral process”. But then that tweet was quoted at the hearing ... Analysis: a historic hearing We’ve offered no opinion, have no view, have no information on potential impact, because it’s not something we’ve looked at. It certainly wasn’t our intention to say that today. – FBI director James Comey, on the president’s tweet Press secretary Sean Spicer downplayed the campaign roles of multiple people mentioned at the hearing, calling Carter Page a “hanger-on”, distancing Trump from Roger Stone and saying Paul Manafort had a “very limited role” for a “very limited” time. But ... It might take just a minute to catch up on the latest politics news. But good journalism takes time and costs money. If you like the Guardian’s politics coverage, please consider joining us by becoming a member for only $6.99 a month. Thanks for reading! Become a Guardian member The Senate judiciary committee held a first day of hearings on the nomination to the supreme court of Judge Neil Gorsuch, but it was mostly filled by senators talking. Gorsuch did read an opening statement. Check back tomorrow! Gorsuch and big business
